intro: Icacorea kallunkii, commonly known as the Kallunkii candlewood, is a flowering plant native to the island of Kauai in Hawaii. It is characterized by its tall, woody structure and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant has compound leaves with serrated edges and is often found in coastal areas and dry forests. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
